api.name: realitydataanalysis
api.description:
Interact with your data analysis jobs.

Create, update, delete jobs.

items.name: jobs-create
items.description:
---

Create a new job based on its type and options

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Created

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax).

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-delete
items.description:
---

Delete an unsubmitted job

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Job was successfully deleted.

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found
Job can't be deleted once it has been submitted.

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-get
items.description:
---

Retrieve job details, such as current state, execution information, outputs, etc.

### Parameters

The job id

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-progress
items.description:
---

Retrieve job progress.

### Parameters

The job id

### Remarks

The job progression is deemed valid when the job is active and won't be available after 30 days.

Client should query with a backoff intervals [15,30,60,120] seconds. The interval between the first and second query is 15 sec and then 30 sec... If the percentage changes the sequence is restarted.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: OK

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found

headers.name: retry-after
headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

responses.description: This response indicates that the user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

items.name: jobs-get-all
items.description:
---

Retrieve list of jobs matching provided filter.

The `iTwinId` in filter is optional. If it is not provided, this will return jobs created by the same user. However, if the iTwinId is provided and the user has access to it, this will return jobs associated with that specific iTwin.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
The $filter query option requests a specific set of jobs.
The given filter is evaluated for each job and only job where the filter evaluates to true are returned.
Properties supported for filtering: `id`, `iTwinId`, `name`, `email`, `type`, `state`, `createdDateTime`, `inputId`, `outputId`.
Supported operators: `eq`, `lt`, `le`, `gt`, `ge`, `ne`, `in`, `and`, `or`.
 Examples of $filter values:
`$filter=iTwinId eq dc720f05-e5f7-448b-ae06-765de46f0af1`
`$filter=inputId in ('482b2968-6a85-4e50-b05c-8acbf828c1bd', '14c03448-bea0-4d76-b53b-4b20bd3f4cbc')`
`$filter=id eq 9e2d27cf-b695-47e9-b7f0-0d47dc3b88ad`
`$filter=createdDateTime gt 2024-06-24T13:00:00Z`

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: Parameter that enables continuing to the next page of the previous paged query. This must be passed exactly as it is in the response body's _links.next property.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of reality analysis jobs to get in each page. Max 1000, but 100 is the default if this parameter is not included.

queryParameters.name: $filter
queryParameters.description:
The $filter query option requests a specific set of jobs.
The given filter is evaluated for each job and only job where the filter evaluates to true are returned.
Properties supported for filtering: `id`, `iTwinId`, `name`, `email`, `type`, `state`, `createdDateTime`, `inputId`, `outputId`.
Supported operators: `eq`, `lt`, `le`, `gt`, `ge`, `ne`, `in`, `and`, `or`.
 Examples of $filter values:
`$filter=iTwinId eq dc720f05-e5f7-448b-ae06-765de46f0af1`
`$filter=inputId in ('482b2968-6a85-4e50-b05c-8acbf828c1bd', '14c03448-bea0-4d76-b53b-4b20bd3f4cbc')`
`$filter=id eq 9e2d27cf-b695-47e9-b7f0-0d47dc3b88ad`
`$filter=createdDateTime gt 2024-06-24T13:00:00Z`

queryParameters.name: continuationToken
queryParameters.description: Parameter that enables continuing to the next page of the previous paged query. This must be passed exactly as it is in the response body's _links.next property.

queryParameters.name: $top
queryParameters.description: The number of reality analysis jobs to get in each page. Max 1000, but 100 is the default if this parameter is not included.

items.name: jobs-patch
items.description:
---

Patch an existing job

Patch can be used for changing the job state (to active or cancelled), updating job type and options or changing cost estimation parameters.

### Authentication

Requires `Authorization` header with valid Bearer token for scope `itwin-platform`.

For more documentation on authorization and how to get access token visit [OAUTH2 Authorization](https://developer.bentley.com/apis/overview/authorization/) page.

---

responses.description: Created

This response indicates that request lacks valid authentication credentials. Access token might not been provided, issued by the wrong issuer, does not have required scopes or request headers were malformed.
Not Found
The 422 (Unprocessable Entity) status code indicates that the request cannot be processed by the server due to a client error (e.g. malformed request syntax).

headers.description: The number of requests exceeds the rate-limit for the client subscription.

schema.title: Error Response
schema.description: Gives details for an error that occurred while handling the request. Note that clients MUST NOT assume that every failed request will produce an object of this schema, or that all of the properties in the response will be non-null, as the error may have prevented this response from being constructed.
